action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I'm starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants, increasing the chances of getting at least one letter correct.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = biddy
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since all letters in the previous guess were incorrect, my next guess will be a completely new set of letters, choosing a word that is also very common and has a different combination of vowels and consonants to maximize the chance of hitting at least one correct letter.
guess: bread

attempts = 2
target_word = biddy
guess = bread
guess_feedback = b<green> r<red> e<red> a<red> d<yellow>

guess_feedback: b<green> r<red> e<red> a<red> d<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With "b" being correct and in the right position, and "d" being correct but in the wrong position, my next guess will build upon this information, keeping "b" as the first letter and trying to utilize "d" in a different position, while introducing new letters to fill in the gaps.
guess: blind

attempts = 3
target_word = biddy
guess = blind
guess_feedback = b<green> l<red> i<yellow> n<red> d<yellow>

guess_feedback: b<green> l<red> i<yellow> n<red> d<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "b" remains in the correct position, "d" is still in the mix but not in the right spot, and "i" has been introduced as a correct but misplaced letter, my next guess will aim to capitalize on this, adjusting the positions of "d" and "i" while keeping "b" at the start, and introducing new letters to replace the incorrect ones.
guess: bitch
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Considering the correct position of "b", the presence of "i" and "d" in the word but not in the right positions, my next guess will be a valid English word that incorporates these letters, trying different arrangements to find the correct fit.
guess: binds

attempts = 4
target_word = biddy
guess = binds
guess_feedback = b<green> i<green> n<red> d<yellow> s<red>

guess_feedback: b<green> i<green> n<red> d<yellow> s<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With "b" and "i" now in their correct positions, and "d" still correct but misplaced, my next guess will focus on finding the right spot for "d" and introducing new letters to replace the incorrect "n" and "s", aiming to complete the word.
guess: bidet

attempts = 5
target_word = biddy
guess = bidet
guess_feedback = b<green> i<green> d<green> e<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: b<green> i<green> d<green> e<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "b", "i", and "d" are all in their correct positions, my next guess will build on this success, replacing the incorrect "e" and "t" with new letters that could fit well in a word starting with "bid", looking for a common and valid English word.
guess: bidsy
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With "b", "i", and "d" in their correct positions, my next guess will be a valid English word that starts with "bid" and is a common term, trying to find the right letters to complete the word.
guess: bidder

Guess does not conform to the format rules
Error: The length of the guessed word is not 5.
game_result = ABORT

guess_explanation: I'm starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants, increasing the chances of getting at least one letter correct.

Since all letters in the previous guess were incorrect, my next guess will be a completely new set of letters, choosing a word that is also very common and has a different combination of vowels and consonants to maximize the chance of hitting at least one correct letter.

With "b" being correct and in the right position, and "d" being correct but in the wrong position, my next guess will build upon this information, keeping "b" as the first letter and trying to utilize "d" in a different position, while introducing new letters to fill in the gaps.

Considering the correct position of "b", the presence of "i" and "d" in the word but not in the right positions, my next guess will be a valid English word that incorporates these letters, trying different arrangements to find the correct fit.

With "b" and "i" now in their correct positions, and "d" still correct but misplaced, my next guess will focus on finding the right spot for "d" and introducing new letters to replace the incorrect "n" and "s", aiming to complete the word.
